spatial_accuracy.notes: General layout is preserved, but door swings are represented as solid abstract volumes rather than standard openings. Window placement on the right-hand bedrooms has been significantly altered from small standard windows to large modern floor-to-ceiling glass panels, distorting the original design intention. The kitchen island geometry is slightly altered compared to the U-shape in the plan.

structural_fidelity.notes: No text or UI elements are present. The roof is correctly removed and the model floats on a neutral background. Points deducted for the garage being separated as a floating island, which while present in the plan as a separate box, is rendered with more distance than indicated by the 2D layout.

furniture_mapping.notes: Kitchen cabinetry, bathroom fixtures, and laundry appliances (WM) are placed accurately. However, the living/dining/bedroom areas are missing furniture blocks (beds, sofas, tables) that would normally characterize those spaces in a full interior mapping.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Style is mostly low-poly and simplified. However, the car model in the garage and the tiling in the bathroom exhibit higher detail and subtle textures/reflections, leaning slightly toward photorealism. Shadowing is also more dramatic than 'flat shading' constraints permit.

detected_errors.description: Missing living room and bedroom furniture (sofas, dining table, beds).
Window proportions distorted; standard windows replaced with large glazed sections in bedrooms.
Abstract solid curved blocks used to represent door swings instead of clear openings.
Lighting and car model exhibit photorealistic qualities and reflections inconsistent with strict low-poly/flat-shade constraints.
